WFC 70: Data Literacy for Wildlife Biologist Welcome to WFC 70

WFC 70: Data Literacy for Wildlife Biologist Rob Furrow 2025-05-02 Welcome to WFC 70 The purpose of WFC 70 is to introduce and strength your data literacy skills. In this course, you will working with data sets, R and R Studio and understanding what data literacy is. This website aims to be a place where we demonstrate solutions to common mistakes, provide more practice, and provide resources to improve your R and data literacy skills. This website was created by Learning Assistants! We hope it is of use :)
1 Getting Started 1.1 Installing R and R Studio 1.2 Downloading on Mac 1.3 Downloading on Windows

1 Getting Started 1.1 Installing R and R Studio A program you will hopefully become familiar with is R and R Studio. Lecture and lab discusses the differences between these two. R is the language you are using to create the graphs. R Studio is where you input the code. One way to think about it is that R Studio is the kitchen and R represents all your ingredients. We will need both on your computer before your first lab. Even if you are not going to be bringing your personal computer to lab, having it can be helpful for homework and the Data Story. 1.2 Downloading on Mac 1.3 Downloading on Windows Once you have successfully downloaded both, donâ€™t be afraid to open R Studio and play around!
